Description: Rim sherd (mended from three fragments) of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery dinos; white slip; exterior: on flat rim, double guilloche pattern between black bands on either side of the rim; below from left, vertical dividing bands consisting of maeander and dot and billet strips; at right, painted decoration consisting of bull (legs and head missing) to right; corner pendant roundel, vertical tongues, pendant triangle and rosettes as filling ornament.
Producer name: Attributed to: Group of the Aphrodite Bowl
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Lemos describes the sherd as part of the Group of the Aphrodite Bowl because it displays a greater amount of variety in the filling ornaments, though similar to those on the Aphrodite Bowl itself (Lemos 1991, 74-5).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 247, no. 298, pl. 36)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0030) (phase 2)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: E175P / E175.16 (Previous Accession Number in Philadelphia, University Museum)
